abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project was
            satisfactory. The key lessons learned are: 1) the same
            agency should be responsible for planning, implementation,
            and O&M (operations & maintenance) of infrastructure
            scheme where possible. 2) Institutional arrangements for
            O&M of infrastructure systems should be put in place as
            early as possible, but no later than completion of
            construction. 3) In order to achieve sustainable
            institutional development through technical assistance,
            institutional components should be demand-driven; terms of
            reference must be prepared by the Borrower; consultant
            selection should be finalized before credit effectiveness;
            and specific milestones should be defined for both physical
            and institutional components of a project. 4) Improving
            solid waste management must be given high priority. 5)
            Effective coordination is essential with other agencies as
            well as non-participating agencies. 6) The project design
            must be kept simple. 7) Involvement of local
            consultant/staff is important. 8) Involvement of community
            and nongovernmental organizations should be sought. 9)
            Private sector participation should be considered as
            alternative means of service delivery. 10) Monitoring
            indicators must be realistic. 11) It is necessary to require
            stricter audit and procurement practice.
